categories.title: Fiction
categories.description: Fictional stories and novels that are not based on real events or people. May include sub-genres such as romance, mystery, and science fiction.

categories.title: Non-fiction
categories.description: Books that are based on real events or people, such as biographies, history books, and self-help books.

categories.title: Children's
categories.description: Books that are written for children, typically up to the age of 12. May include picture books, chapter books, and middle-grade novels.

categories.title: Young Adult
categories.description: Books that are written for teenagers, typically between the ages of 12 and 18. May include coming-of-age stories, dystopian novels, and fantasy series.

categories.title: Science Fiction
categories.description: Books that are set in a speculative future or in alternative realities, often featuring advanced technology and space exploration.

categories.title: Fantasy
categories.description: Books that feature magical or supernatural elements, such as wizards, dragons, and mythical creatures.

categories.title: Romance
categories.description: Books that focus on romantic relationships, often with a happy ending. May include sub-genres such as historical romance and contemporary romance.

categories.title: Mystery
categories.description: Books that involve a crime or puzzle that needs to be solved. May include sub-genres such as detective fiction and thrillers.

categories.title: Horror
categories.description: Books that are intended to scare or unsettle the reader, often featuring supernatural or macabre elements.

categories.title: Poetry
categories.description: Books that contain poems, which are often characterized by their use of language, rhythm, and imagery.

publishers.name: Penguin Random House
publishers.description: One of the largest book publishers in the world, Penguin Random House publishes a wide range of books across multiple genres, from literary fiction to popular non-fiction.

publishers.name: HarperCollins
publishers.description: A global publisher with a wide range of imprints, HarperCollins publishes books for adults, children, and young adults. Some of its most well-known authors include Neil Gaiman, J.R.R. Tolkien, and J.K. Rowling.

publishers.name: Simon & Schuster
publishers.description: A leading publisher of both fiction and non-fiction books, Simon & Schuster has a long history of publishing bestselling books, including To Kill a Mockingbird by Harper Lee and The Catcher in the Rye by J.D. Salinger.

publishers.name: Hachette Book Group
publishers.description: A division of Hachette Livre, the second-largest book publisher in the world, Hachette Book Group publishes books across multiple genres, including mystery, romance, and science fiction.

publishers.name: Macmillan Publishers
publishers.description: A global publisher with multiple imprints, Macmillan publishes books across a wide range of genres, including children's books, romance, and science fiction.

publishers.name: Scholastic Corporation
publishers.description: The world's largest publisher and distributor of children's books, Scholastic Corporation publishes books for children of all ages, from picture books to young adult novels.

publishers.name: Bloomsbury Publishing
publishers.description: A leading independent publisher with a focus on literary fiction and non-fiction, Bloomsbury Publishing has published books by many notable authors, including J.K. Rowling and Khaled Hosseini.

publishers.name: Penguin Group
publishers.description: An imprint of Penguin Random House, Penguin Group is a well-known publisher of literary fiction and non-fiction, including works by Jane Austen and George Orwell.

publishers.name: W.W. Norton & Company
publishers.description: A publisher of college textbooks and other educational materials, W.W. Norton & Company also publishes general interest books across multiple genres, including history, science, and literature.

publishers.name: Random House
publishers.description: An imprint of Penguin Random House, Random House publishes a wide range of fiction and non-fiction, including books by bestselling authors such as Dan Brown and John Grisham.
